question: Has the raise in the cost of cigarettes helped you cut back or quit?
question_content:
I'm just curious because I work at a gas station and smokes are going up higher and higher. There has got to be an almost 2 dollar difference from when I started working there, last summer. 

Are the obnoxious prices helping you cut back or quit? I'm just curious because I ring up more and more every time I go to work, and its disgusting.

answers.answer_content:
Actually, I'm smoking more now than I did before.  I am rolling my own and the taste is much better.  Since the price of rolling my own is cheaper, I'm using the more premium tobaccos (my non-smoking husband even likes the smell of the premium stuff).  Plus I've started to grow my own.  I have a dozen plants.

If the price hadn't gone up so high, I'd still just be buying pre-made boring cigarettes.

No
I smoke more now than I did when I started smoking 10 years ago.
I go through a carton every 1.5 weeks now.  The longer you smoke, the more addicted you become, price is no deterrent.
Somewhat, I have moved onto a cheaper pack of cigarettes and I don't buy packs as often as I used to.
